item.title: Running Python Files: Module vs Script
item.description: Introduction In Python, a file can be run either as a script or as a module. Understanding the difference between these two approaches is crucial for proper code organization and execution. Let’s explore both methods and their use cases. Running as a Script vs Module Script Execution When you run a Python file directly, it’s executed as a script: # Running directly from command line python script.py Module Execution When you import a file as a module into another Python file:
